page.title: 12FARMING in SPEY VALLEY (2)
page.content:
Farmers here either own their land or lease it, the lease usually passing from father to son. Following a sound practical upbringing many sons now attend college or university to study agriculture and thus add academic training to natural interest. As the nearest vet is based some thirty miles away these farmers, having benefited from a broad education, can cope with many animal malidies on their own.
Stock sales are held in nearby Kingussie on four occasions every autumn by the Aberdeen and Northern Mart. These sales are well attended and are considered a social highlight for farmers and shepherds, a rare chance to catch up with friends, some of whom live in quite isolated parts of the valley.
